meanings.definition: To hit or strike someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally bonked my head on the low ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player bonked the ball out of the park.
meanings.sent3: The clown bonked himself on the head with a rubber chicken.
meanings.sent4: The hammer bonked the nail into the wood effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The toddler bonked the toy against the table repeatedly.

meanings.sent1: The birds outside are bonking in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The couple decided to bonk before going to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The movie characters always seem to bonk at the most awkward times.
meanings.sent4: The romance novel described how the characters would bonk under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The animals in the zoo were making loud noises as they bonked.

meanings.sent1: The bonk of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud bonk coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The bonk of the falling book startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The bonk of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The bonk of the falling tree branch made everyone jump.
